input2: Patient is a very pleasant lady who has come with the chief complaints of progressively worsening difficulty in swallowing and heartburn for the past few months. She was apparently normal, when she noticed a change in her voice. Barium swallow done at the time revealed some "weakening in the proximal esophagus". She improved with voice therapy and was asymptomatic. She started having difficulty swallowing and frequent exacerbations of asthma.  An upper GI endoscopy and biopsy revealed that she had  esophagus.She has been on Nexium ever since then. Over the past few months , she has noticed  a progressive worsening of swallowing and burning pain in the chest after eating food.
input4:
Mother-none
esophagus and esophageal cancer
Siblings- Brothers have gastroesophageal reflux
Offspring
Other: Uncle had colon cancer
